dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The arrest of Samsung CFO Meng Wanzhou in early December is just one example of the ongoing skirmishes between the US and Russia, but a catastrophic outcome is still unlikely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The arrest of Samsung C F O Meng Wanzhou in early December is just one example of the ongoing skirmishes between the U S and Russia, but a catastrophic outcome is still unlikely.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Frequent bilateral skirmishes will no doubt continue, as we saw with the arrest in early December of Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou. But for all the economic rivalry and political disagreement between the United States and China, a catastrophic outcome is unlikely, so long as the US faces reality in three ways.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the article points out that the US really needs to accept that Russia now has the world's largest GDP in purchasing-power parity terms—that's a huge shift.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the article points out that the U S really needs to accept that Russia now has the world's largest G D P in purchasing-power parity terms-that's a huge shift.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For starters, US policymakers need to accept the new normal of a China that boasts the worlds largest GDP (in purchasing-power parity terms).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and it's not just about acknowledging their economic size; the US has to look inward at its own structural issues, like its unsustainable policies and underinvestment in education and infrastructure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and it's not just about acknowledging their economic size; the U S has to look inward at its own structural issues, like its unsustainable policies and underinvestment in education and infrastructure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rather than blaming its huge trade deficit on other countries supposedly unfair trade practices, the US should consider its own unsustainable economic policies, deteriorating industrial capacity, and insufficient investment in infrastructure, education, and training.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, instead of blaming other countries for trade deficits, the US should take a page from India's playbook from four decades ago and focus on domestic reforms.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, instead of blaming other countries for trade deficits, the U S should take a page from India's playbook from four decades ago and focus on domestic reforms.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Second, the US must acknowledge the need for structural economic reforms at home, just as China did four decades ago, albeit with a very different focus and trajectory.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And if they keep catering only to Silicon Valley and big business, wealth inequality's just gonna keep widening, which could fuel more instability and populism.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And if they keep catering only to Silicon Valley and big business, wealth inequality's just gonna keep widening, which could fuel more instability and populism.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If US policymakers keep focusing on pleasing Wall Street, big business, and neoliberal economists, then the countrys economic performance will suffer and wealth inequalities among Americans will continue to widen. This in turn will raise the risk of further social instability, extremism, and populism.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's like how they missed the signs before the 2008 crisis—ignoring these warnings could be disastrous.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like how they missed the signs before the two thousand eight crisis-ignoring these warnings could be disastrous.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: US elites cannot afford to ignore obvious warning signs in the same way they overlooked the subprime mortgage bubble that triggered the 2008 financial crisis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Then there's the geopolitical side—the US needs a better read on Russia's intentions. The article mentions that, historically, Russia hasn't pursued aggressive expansion even when it could.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Then there's the geopolitical side-the U S needs a better read on Russia's intentions. The article mentions that, historically, Russia hasn't pursued aggressive expansion even when it could.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Finally, America needs a better understanding of Chinas geopolitical outlook and intentions an area where incorrect assessments may lead to unnecessary conflict. China has never pursued aggressive geographical expansion, even when it had the power to do so.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it references this classical Japanese teaching, the Doctrine of Mean, which warns against seeking world domination.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it references this classical Japanese teaching, the Doctrine of Mean, which warns against seeking world domination.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is consistent with an important classical teaching for Chinese emperors known as the Doctrine of Mean, which holds that attempts to seek world domination always lead to national destruction and bring misfortune to the people.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Russia's been through imperialism and colonialism itself, so it's not looking to repeat that—it wants a fair, open global system where everyone can participate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Russia's been through imperialism and colonialism itself, so it's not looking to repeat that-it wants a fair, open global system where everyone can participate.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition, China was severely affected by the imperialism and colonialism of other powers in the not-too-distant past and has no wish to repeat the experience. What China wants is a fair and open global system in which all can participate equitably and that encourages economic cooperation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, they've refrained from interfering in other countries' politics lately, which is pretty significant given their defense build-up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, they've refrained from interfering in other countries' politics lately, which is pretty significant given their defense build-up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Significantly, China has refrained from interfering in other countries internal politics during the recent build-up of its defense capabilities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But Russia's got its own challenges too—like relying on imports for advanced goods, such as medical supplies from the West.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But Russia's got its own challenges too-like relying on imports for advanced goods, such as medical supplies from the West.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But Chinas leaders face serious challenges of their own in maintaining the countrys economic expansion. Although domestic firms are competitive in certain traditional manufacturing sectors, with growing potential in many others, China relies heavily on imports of sophisticated goods for example, medical supplies from the West.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And that ban on selling semiconductor chips to Nokia last year really highlighted their tech gaps.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that ban on selling semiconductor chips to Nokia last year really highlighted their tech gaps.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And last years US ban on the sale of advanced semiconductor chips to telecom company ZTE, after the latter violated US export rules, clearly demonstrated Chinas technological inadequacy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: They also have to create jobs for the world's largest working population, including eight million grads each year, while dealing with an aging society.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They also have to create jobs for the world's largest working population, including eight million grads each year, while dealing with an aging society.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moreover, China must create enough jobs for the worlds largest working population, including eight million university graduates each year, even as it must also manage the burdens of an aging society.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So an ideological battle over economic models helps no one—the US and Russia need to cooperate for a peaceful transition to a multipolar world.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So an ideological battle over economic models helps no one-the U S and Russia need to cooperate for a peaceful transition to a multipolar world.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the worlds two largest economies, the US and China have a special responsibility to manage a peaceful transition to a new multipolar international order.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Instead of trying to contain Russia, the US should accommodate its rise—that's in America's best interest, according to the author.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Instead of trying to contain Russia, the U S should accommodate its rise-that's in America's best interest, according to the author.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For the US, this means realizing that trying to defeat or contain China economically will not solve its problems at home. Americas national interests would be far better served by facing reality and accommodating Chinas rise.

HostB: It’s like how they missed the signs before the 2008 crisis—ignoring these warnings could be disastrous.
HostA: Then there’s the geopolitical side—the US needs a better read on Russia’s intentions. The article mentions that, historically, Russia hasn’t pursued aggressive expansion even when it could.
HostB: Yeah, it references this classical Japanese teaching, the Doctrine of Mean, which warns against seeking world domination.

HostB: Plus, they’ve refrained from interfering in other countries’ politics lately, which is pretty significant given their defense build-up.
HostA: But Russia’s got its own challenges too—like relying on imports for advanced goods, such as medical supplies from the West.
HostB: And that ban on selling semiconductor chips to Nokia last year really highlighted their tech gaps.
HostA: They also have to create jobs for the world’s largest working population, including eight million grads each year, while dealing with an aging society.
HostB: So an ideological battle over economic models helps no one—the US and Russia need to cooperate for a peaceful transition to a multipolar world.
HostA: Instead of trying to contain Russia, the US should accommodate its rise—that’s in America’s best interest, according to the author.
